newsitem.title: USA: Knight-Ridder sees Q4 as strongest.
newsitem.headline: Knight-Ridder sees Q4 as strongest.

text.p: Knight-Ridder Inc said Tuesday that the fourth quarter would be its "strongest" and that it continues "to anticipate an excellent year."
It attributed the outlook to declining newsprint prices and a turnaround in its Detroit operations, where it said it expects "a positive contribution" for the first time since striking began there.

"This change in strategic direction will require increased levels of investment by Knight-Ridder Information during the balance of this year and throughout 1997 and 1998," the company stated. "As a result, we anticipate that KRII will show only a very modest profit in the 1996-1998 period."

The company reported third quarter earnings today of $1.31 per share, including a $0.94 gain from the sale of Knight-Ridder Financial. Excluding the gain, the company's per share earnings was $0.37, compared to $0.07 in the year-ago quarter.
